Health-Monitor.description: The response body contains information about Health Monitoring data of Big Data Cloud instance.

bdc4Node-bdcsce-4.label: bdc4Node BDC name node master NN_MASTER_VM 4

domainName.description: Identity domain ID for the Big Data Cloud account.

components.description: This JSON Object contains one or more name/value pairs where name represents a component i.e bdcsce. Value is an object containing health details of corresponding Big Data Cloud component.
components.title: components

dataQuality.description: The state of the heath report.

message.description: A message relating the state of the heath report.

dataQuality.title: dataQuality

serviceId.description: ID of the Big Data Cloud instance.

serviceName.description: Name of the Big Data Cloud instance.

serviceType.description: Type of the Big Data Cloud instance.

statusMessage.description: Status of the Big Data Cloud instance. For example, Running.

timestamp.description: Time at which the status was recorded (UTC).

Health-Monitor.title: Health-Monitor

Health-Monitor-Component.description: Groups the health details for Big Data Cloud component.

componentId.description: ID of the Big Data Cloud instance component.

componentType.description: Type of the component. For example, bdcsce.

serviceId.description: ID of the Big Data Cloud instance.

status.description: Status of the component. Valid values are UP, DOWN, or ERROR (indicating a system error was encountered during health check).

statusMessage.description: Status message, such as component running.

timestamp.description: Time at which the status was recorded (UTC).

vmInstances.description: This JSON Object contains one or more name/value pairs where name represents a VM of component. Value is an object containing health details of each VM associated with the Big Data Cloud instance component.
vmInstances.title: vmInstances

Health-Monitor-Component.title: Health-Monitor-Component

Health-Monitor-VM.description: The health details of each VMs associated with the Big Data Cloud component.

healthData.description: The health summary of the VM.

displayName.description: Display name for the health monitoring runtime metric.

unit.description: Unit measurement of the metric. For example, MB, seconds.

value.description: Value of the health monitoring data.

VMDataVolumeUtilization.description: Total data storage used in percent.

displayName.description: Display name for the health monitoring runtime metric.

unit.description: Unit measurement of the metric. For example, MB, seconds.

value.description: Value of the health monitoring data.

VMDataVolumeUtilization.title: VMDataVolumeUtilization

VMmemory.description: Total free memory in the VM.

displayName.description: Display name for the health monitoring runtime metric.

unit.description: Unit measurement of the metric. For example, MB, seconds.

value.description: Value of the health monitoring data.

VMmemory.title: VMmemory

healthData.title: healthData

label.description: Labels of the VM. For example, bdcsce.

servers.description: This JSON Object contains one or more name/value pairs where name represents a server running on a VM. Value is an object containing health details of Big Data Cloud instance server(s) running on VM.
servers.title: servers

status.description: Status of the VM. Valid values are UP, DOWN, or ERROR (indicating a system error was encountered during health check).

statusMessage.description: Status message, such as VM running.

timestamp.description: Time at which the status was recorded (UTC).

Health-Monitor-VM.title: Health-Monitor-VM

Health-Monitor-server.description: The health details of Big Data Cloud instance server(s) running on a VM.

serverName.description: Name of the Big Data Cloud instance Server.

status.description: Status of the VM. Valid values are UP, DOWN, or ERROR (indicating a system error was encountered during health check).

statusMessage.description: Status message, such as server Running

timestamp.description: Time at which the status was recorded (UTC).

View-All-Precheck-Operations.description: The response body includes information about the patch precheck. When viewing all patching prechecks, the response body includes information about all patch prechecks executed on this service instance.

items.description: The response body includes information about the patch precheck. When viewing all patching prechecks, the response body includes information about all patch prechecks executed on this service instance.

endDate.description: Date and time that the patching precheck operation stopped.

href.description: URL for checking the status of the patching precheck job. This attribute displays only when viewing all patching precheck operations.

inProgress.description: Flag that specifies whether the patch precheck is still in progress.

jobId.description: Job ID for the patching precheck operation.

performedBy.description: Name of the user account used to perform the patch precheck.

preCheckMessages.description: List of patching precheck messages. No patching precheck messages are returned when the precheck completes successfully.

items.description: List of patching precheck messages. No patching precheck messages are returned when the precheck completes successfully.

preCheckMessages.title: preCheckMessages-array

startDate.description: Date and time that the patching precheck operation started.

status.description: Status of the patching precheck operation. Valid values include: PASSED_PRECHECK - Patching precheck passed. DIDNT_PASS_PRECHECK - Patching precheck did not pass. Check the preCheckMessages attribute for more information. DIDNT_FINISHED_PRECHECK - An internal error was encountered and the patching precheck could not be performed.

items.title: View-All-Precheck-Operations

View-All-Precheck-Operations.title: View-All-Precheck-Operations-array

View-Applied-Patches.description: Contains details of all Patches applied on Big Data Cloud instance.

example.patchDescription: Update to latest version of BDCSCE, 1.6.0.1.0.1612030118

rollbackResult.additionalNote: This note is the default note: Rolling back the service from the patch [26].

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the patch.

appliedBy.description: Name of the user that applied the patch. system displays if the patch was applied by an auto-update scheduled job.

appliedDate.description: Date and time that the patch was applied.

currentPatchLevel.description: Current patch level for the component.

id.description: Unique ID of the patching operation. Use this ID to get details of a patching operation.

inProgress.description: Flag that specifies whether the patch is still in progress.

jobId.description: Job ID for the patch operation.

lastStatus.description: Status of the patch operation. For example: IN PROGRESS, COMPLETED, and FAILED. COMPLETED_ROLLBACK is displayed when an applied patch has been rolled back.

lastStatusMessage.description: Last message logged for the patch operation.

operationType.description: Patch operating being performed. Valid values include: Rollback, Patching, and None.

patchCategory.description: Category of the patch. For example: General, Multiple, Security, and so on.

patchComponents.description: Group the details of the patches to be applied.
patchComponents.title: patchComponents-array

patchReleaseUrl.description: URL that provides more information about the patch.

patchSeverity.description: Severity of the patch. For example Normal, Mandatory, Recommended, and so on.

patchType.description: Patch type classification. For example, Quarterly, Security.

patchingResult.description: Groups information about the results of the patch.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the patch.

appliedBy.description: Name of the user that applied the patch. system displays if the patch was applied by an auto-update scheduled job.

completeLog.description: System messages that track the patch operations.

customRollbackId.description: ID to be used in a rollback operation.

jobId.description: Job ID for the patch operation.

patchingId.description: D of the applied patch operation.

patchingStatus.description: Status of the patching operation. For example, COMPLETED. COMPLETED_ROLLBACK is displayed when an applied patch has been rolled back.

progressMessages.description: List of progress messages for the patch.

items.description: List of progress messages for the patch.

progressMessages.title: progressMessages-array

releaseVersionBeforeThisPatch.description: Big Data Cloud release version before this patch.

resultMessage.description: System message that describes the patching operation.

startDate.description: Date and time that the patch operation started.

strategy.description: Patching strategy. For example, Rolling. To minimize service disruption, the patch is applied in a rolling pattern, patching a single node at a time.

versionBeforeThisPatch.description: Version of the component before the patch was applied.

patchingResult.title: patchingResult

progressMessages.description: List of progress messages for the patch.

items.description: List of progress messages for the patch.

progressMessages.title: progressMessages-array

releaseDate.description: Date and time patch was released.

rollbackId.description: ID of the rollback that is associated to the completed patching operation. The ID is used to rollback a patch operation.

rollbackResult.description: Groups information about the results of the rollback operation. This attribute displays only when a rollback of the patch had been performed.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the rollback.

appliedBy.description: Name of the user that performed the rollback.

completeLog.description: System messages that track the rollback operations.

jobId.description: Job ID for the rollback operation.

patchingStatus.description: Status of the rollback operation. For example, COMPLETED_ROLLBACK.

progressMessages.description: List of progress messages for the rollback.

items.description: List of progress messages for the rollback.

progressMessages.title: progressMessages-array

resultMessage.description: System message that describes the rollback operation.

startDate.description: Date and time that the rollback operation started.

rollbackResult.title: rollbackResult

rollbackVersion.description: Version to which the patched component will be rolled back.

toVersion.description: Version of Big Data Cloud instance that was patched.

items.description: Contains details of a patch available.

availablePatchGuiMetadata.description: Instruction to the metadata UI about the patch.

supportsPreCheck.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch supports precheck via UI.

availablePatchGuiMetadata.title: availablePatchGuiMetadata

entryDate.description: Date and time the patch is created.

entryUserId.description: Name of the user that created the patch.

includesConfigUpgrade.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch includes a configuration upgrade.

induceDownTime.description: Flag that indicates whether the patching induces a downtime of the service.

isAutoApply.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch can be applied automatically.

isCustomerVisible.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch is visible to customer.

isDeleted.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch has been deleted and is no longer available. The information about the patch is not removed from the list of available patches in order to maintain an historical record of all patches.

patchCategory.description: Category of the patch. For example: General, Upgrade, Multiple, Security, and so on.

patchComponents.description: Group the details of each patches in the component.

patchCustomActions.description: List of customer actions during patching.

patchReleaseUrl.description: URL that provides more information about the patch.

patchSeverity.description: everity of the patch. For example Normal, Mandatory, Recommended, and so on.

patchType.description: Patch type classification. For example, Quarterly, Security.

releaseDate.description: Date and time the patch is released.

releaseVersion.description: Release version of the component in this patch.

requiresRestart.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch requires a restart of the service instance.

serviceType.description: Type of Oracle Cloud Service. For example: BDCSCE, Big Data Cloud.

serviceTypeVersions.description: Big Data Cloud instance version to which the patch can be applied. For example: 5.7, Any, where Any indicates that the patch can be applied to any version.

serviceVersion.description: Big Data Cloud instance version to which the patch can be applied. For example: 5.7, Any, where Any indicates that the patch can be applied to any version.

supportedStrategy.description: Supported patching strategy. For example: In Place.

activityLogId.description: The log ID of the operation.

authDomain.description: Identity domain for the Big Data Cloud account.

endDate.description: The date and time when the job ended.

identityDomain.description: The identity domain hosting the instance.

jobId.description: The ID of the current job.

operationId.description: The corresponding ID of the instance.

operationType.description: The type of the operation, such as CREATE_SERVICE.

serviceId.description: The corresponding ID of the instance.

serviceType.description: The service type of the instance, such as Big Data Cloud.

startDate.description: The date and time when the job started.

status.description: Current status of the job; one of: In Progress, Succeded, Failed.

summaryMessage.description: The summary of the activity log.

componentType.description: The type of the component. It is usually bdcsce for Big Data Cloud.

creationDate.description: The date and time when the service instance was created.

hostname.description: The host name of the compute node.

id.description: Internal identifier for the compute node.

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the compute node.

isAdminNode.description: Indicates whether the compute node is an administration node.

label.description: The label of the compute node.

publicIpAddress.description: The IP address of the compute node.

role.description: The role of the compute node. It is usually BDCSCE_VM for Big Data Cloud.

servers.description: This JSON Object contains one or more name/value pairs where name represents a server of service instance and value is an object containing corresponding server details.
servers.title: servers

shapeId.description: The Oracle Compute Cloud shape of the compute node.

state.description:
The current state of the compute node. Valid values are:
  • Ready: Fully operational
  • Starting: Being created or initialized
  • Stopping: Being stopped
  • Error: Has some error condition(s)

storageVolumes.description: This JSON Object contains one or more name/value pairs where name represents a storage volume of VM instance. Value is an object containing corresponding storage volume details.
storageVolumes.title: storageVolumes

totalStorage.description: The size in GB of the total storage allocated to the compute node.

usageType.description: The usage type of the compute node. It is usually BDCSCE_VM for Big Data Cloud.

uuid.description: Universally unique identifier for the compute node.

vmId.description: The ID of the compute node.

activityDate.description: The date and time of the current activity.

adminHostName.description: The host name of the administration node.

attributes.description: This JSON Object contains one or more name/value pairs where name represents service component attributes such as compute shape, connect string, etc. value is an object containing corresponding service component attribute details.
attributes.title: attributes

componentId.description: ID of the service instance component.

creationDate.description: The date and time when the service instance was created.

userHosts.description: This JSON Object contains one or more name/value pairs where name represents a User Host of Big Data Cloud instance, value is an object containing corresponding User Host details.
userHosts.title: userHosts

instanceName.description: The component name of the service instance. For example, bdcsce.

instanceRole.description: The role of the service instance. It is None for Big Data Cloud.

serviceId.description: ID of the Big Data Cloud instance.

state.description: The current state of the component.

storageVolumes.description: This JSON Object contains one or more name/value pairs where name represents a storage volume of component instance. Value is an object containing corresponding storage volume details.
storageVolumes.title: storageVolumes

version.description: The version of the component. For example, 1.6.0.1.

vmInstances.description: This JSON Object contains one or more name/value pairs where name represents a Virtual Machine of Big Data Cloud instance, value is an object containing corresponding Virtual Machine details.
vmInstances.title: vmInstances

isKeyBinding.description: Indicates whether the attribute is key binding.

computeSiteName.description: The Oracle Cloud location housing the service instance.

creationDate.description: Date and time of creation of Big Data Cloud Instance

creator.description: Name of the user account used to create the Big Data Cloud instance.

domainName.description: Identity domain Id for Big Data Cloud account

editionDisplayName.description: The display name of Big Data Cloud Server edition. For example, Service Edition.

metaVersion.description: The release version of metadata service manager.

meteringFrequency.description: The billing frequency of the service instance; either MONTHLY or HOURLY.

meteringFrequencyDisplayName.description: The display name of the metering frequency; either Monthly or Hourly.

releaseVersion.description: The release version of bdcsce. For example, 1.6.0.1.0.

serviceDescription.description: The service Description of the service instance. For example, Layered Service.

serviceId.description: ID of the Big Data Cloud instance.

serviceLevel.description: The service level of the service instance. For example, PAAS for Oracle Cloud Service.

serviceLevelDisplayName.description: The display name of the service level. For example, Big Data Cloud.

serviceName.description: Name of the Big Data Cloud instance.

serviceStateDisplayName.description: The display name of the service current state.

serviceType.description: The service type of the instance, such as Big Data Cloud (BDCSCE).

state.description: State of Big Data Cloud instance. For example, READY.

subscription.description: The subscription type of the service instance; either MONTHLY or HOURLY.

view-service-instances.description: The response body contains information about all Big Data Cloud instances.

id.description: Internal identifier for the compute node.

label.description: The label of the compute node.

role.description: The role of the compute node. It is usually BDCSCE_VM for Big Data Cloud.

The current state of the compute node. Valid values are:
  • Ready: Fully operational

usageType.description: The usage type of the compute node. It is usually BDCSCE_VM for Big Data Cloud.

uuid.description: Universally unique identifier for the compute instance.

vmId.description: The ID of the compute node.

vmStateDisplayName.description: The display name of the current state of the compute node.

creationDate.description: Date and time when the server was created.

serverType.description: Type of the server, such as BDCSCE, Big Data Cloud.

isUserVisible.description: A flag indicating whether storage volume is user visible or not.

partitions.description: Number of partitions of the storage volume.

alltagsassignments-response.description: The response body contains information about all tags and their assignments.

items.description: Groups details of tags and their assignments.

tagsassignments-response.description: The response body contains information about all tags and their assignments.

tagsassignments-details.description: Each object describes a tag and its assignments.

isExternalTag.description:
Flag to identify an account tag.

This property is only shown if the value is true.

isMeteringTag.description:
Flag to identify an account tag that is used for metering.

This property is only shown if the value is true.

state.description:
Whether a tag is created or is in the process of being deleted. Possible values: Ready, Deleting

This property is not shown when you use the Create and Assign Tags endpoint or Create and Delete Assignments endpoint.

assignments.description: Groups assignment details for this tag.

services.description: Groups the service resources assigned with this tag.

assignments.description:
Groups the tag assignments to create.

Note: The maximum number of tags allowed for a service instance is 50.

services.description:
Groups the service resources to tag.

With account non-metering tags, only tag assignments are performed. Each existing tag is assigned to each service resource.

tags.description:
Groups the tags to create.

For account non-metering tags, groups the tags for assignment only.

Each tag object is a key/value pair.

tagscreate-request.description:
Each tag is a key/value pair.

For account non-metering tags, specify the existing tag key and value for assignment.

key.description: Specify the key for this tag to create. A tag key can contain letters, numbers, dashes (-), and underscores ( _ ), and it can contain up to 128 characters.

value.description:
Specify the value for this tag to create. A tag value can contain up to 256 characters and is case-sensitive.

Default value is an empty string (if you do not provide a specific value).

tagsToDelete.description: Groups the tags to delete. Each tag object is a key/value pair.

value.description:
Value for this tag.

Default value is an empty string (if you do not provide a specific value).

details.description: Groups details of a bad request, not found response, or conflict response.

serviceassignment-details.description: Each object describes a service resource.

assignmentState.description:
Whether tag assignment or unassignment is in progress. Possible values: Assigning, Unassigning, Assigned

This property is not shown when you use the Create and Assign Tags endpoint or Create and Delete Assignments endpoint.

serviceType.description:
Type of service.

For example, BDC for a Big Data Cloud instance.

serviceName.description: Name of the service instance to tag (or untag).

serviceType.description:
Type of service.

For example, BDC for a Big Data Cloud instance.

createAssignmentsTo.description:
Groups the resources for tag assignments.

Note: The maximum number of tags allowed for a service instance is 50.

services.description: Groups the service resources to assign tags to. The tags are specified in tagsToAssign.

tagsToAssign.description: Groups the tags to assign. Each tag object is a key/value pair.

deleteAssignmentsFrom.description: Groups the resources for tag unassignments.

services.description: Groups the service resources to unassign tags from. The tags are specified in tagsToUnassign.

tagsToUnassign.description: Groups the tags to unassign. Each tag object is a key/value pair.

info.description: This REST API enables you to create and manage Oracle Big Data Cloud instances on Oracle Public Cloud. The API provides an alternative to using the web-based user interface. All documentation is applicable to using the API on Oracle Public Cloud unless otherwise indicated.
info.title: REST API to Manage Oracle Big Data Cloud
info.x-summary: This REST API enables you to create and manage Oracle Big Data Cloud instances on Oracle Public Cloud.

get.description: Returns the status of an operation performed on Big Data Cloud instance

parameters.description: Base64 encoding of the user name and password of the user making the request.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Identity domain Id for Big Data Cloud account.
parameters.name: identityDomainId

parameters.description: Job ID of an operation.
parameters.name: jobId

messages.message: Started operation to delete service [instanceName] in domain [identityDomainId].
Started delete service for tenant domain=[identityDomainId] service=[instanceName]
Skipping disable command since enable was never accepted
Skipping deprovision command since provision was never accepted
Completed delete service for  tenant domain=[identityDomainId] service=[instanceName]
Completed deletion of service [instanceName] in domain [identityDomainId].

activityLogId.description: The log ID of the operation.

authDomain.description: Identity domain Id for Big Data Cloud account.

endDate.description: The date and time when the job ended.

identityDomain.description: Identity domain Id for Big Data Cloud account.

jobId.description: Job ID of an operation provided.

activityDate.description: The date and time of the current activity.

operationId.description: The corresponding ID of the instance.

operationType.description: The type of the operation, such as CREATE_SERVICE.

serviceId.description: The corresponding ID of the instance.

serviceName.description: Name of Big Data Cloud instance.

serviceType.description: The service type of the instance, such as bdcsce.

startDate.description: The date and time when the job started.

status.description: Current status of the job; one of: In Progress, Succeded, Failed.

summaryMessage.description: The summary of the activity log.

404.description: Not Found. Returned if Job ID is unavailable.

get.summary: View the Status of an Operation by Job Id

get.description: Returns information about all Big Data Cloud instances in your Identity domain Id.

parameters.description: Identity domain Id for Big Data Cloud account.
parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME

parameters.description: Base64 encoding of the user name and password of the user making the request.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Identity domain Id for Big Data Cloud account.
parameters.name: identityDomainId

202.description: Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other HTTP status codes.

post.description: Creates an Big Data Cloud Instance.

parameters.description: Identity domain Id for Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId

parameters.description: The request body defines the details of the create service instance request.
parameters.name: body

cloudStorageContainer.description: Name of an existing Container Service Classic container to be associated with the cluster, or a new one to be created. The container is used for writing application logs and reading application JARs and other supporting files.  You must enter the complete (fully qualified) REST URL for Container Service Classic, appended by the container name.  Copy the REST endpoint URL from the My Services page for Container Service Classic and append the container name to it. For example: https://a9999999.storage.oraclecorp.com/v1/Storage-a9999999/bdcsce .  Note: The container name may not contain underscores.  The same formatting requirement applies to the cloudStorageContainer attribute in the REST API.

cloudStoragePassword.description: Enter password credential for the Oracle cloud storage account.

cloudStorageUser.description: Enter username credential for the Oracle cloud storage account.

ociCloudStorageBucket.description: OCI Cloud Storage Bucket URL eg: oci://bdcsce@mytenancy/ where bdcsce is the default bucket where application binaries and application logs are stored.  mytenancy is your Tenancy

ociCloudStorageFingerprint.description: OCI Cloud Storage PEM Key Fingerprint.  This has to be generated, please refer to 'How to Generate an API Signing Key' section in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure documentation.

ociCloudStoragePemKey.description: OCI Cloud Storage PEM Key.   This has to be generated, please refer to 'How to Generate an API Signing Key' section in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure documentation.

ociCloudStorageUrl.description: Full OCI Cloud Storage URL, eg: https://objectstorage.us-phoenix-1.oraclecloud.com .

ociCloudStorageUserOCID.description: OCI Cloud Storage User OCID.  Refer to 'Required Keys and OCIDs' in Developer Tools documentation of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure

region.description: When you are using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), provide the region string. Otherwise do not provide a value. Select a region that's within the default data region of your account. If your default data region is EMEA, then select eu-frankfurt-1 or uk-london-1. If your default data region is North America, then select us-ashburn-1 or us-phoenix-1.

subnet.description: When you are using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), provide the subnet string. Specify the Oracle Cloud Identifier (OCID) of a subnet from a virtual cloud network (VCN) that you had created previously on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. For the instructions to create a VCN and subnet, see Prerequisites for Oracle Platform Services on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure documentation. The OCID is a unique autogenerated ID. To find out the OCID of a subnet, go to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure web console, select the Networking tab, click the VCN that your subnet is in, and look for the OCID field under the subnet that you want to use.

availabilityDomain.description: When you are using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), provide the availabilityDomain string. Otherwise do not provide a value.

IDCSEnabled.description: Designates whether IDCS authentication is enabled.  If not enabled, HTTP Basic authentication is leveraged to authenticate a cluster user.

adminPassword.description: Password for the Big Data Cloud user. Password must be at least 8 characters long with at least one lower case letter, one upper case letter,  one number and one special character. For example, Ach1z0#d.

adminUsername.description: User name for the Big Data Cloud. User name should start with a letter, consist of letters and numbers, and be between 2 to 25 characters.

bdfsCacheStorage.description: Usable Cache, value in GB. Actual allocated physical storage will be the value specified for BDFS plus additional 5% for intermediate logs. Oracle block storage has an inbuilt replication of 2x.

clusterSize.description: Big Data processing units are distributed across different VMs. Value must be atleast 1. Choosing 3 or more nodes provide high availability(HA) with multiple master nodes. If less than 3 nodes specified, only one node will be master node with all critical services running on same node in non-HA mode

deploymentProfile.description: Deployment Profile defines a specialized cluster that has been optimized for a specific use case. "FULL" - Provisions cluster with Spark, MapReduce, Zeppelin, Hive, Spark Thrift, Big Data File System. "BASIC" - Provisions cluster with Spark, MapReduce and Zeppelin

hdfsStorage.description: Usable HDFS Storage, value in GB. Actual allocated physical storage will be twice the value specified for HDFS replication plus additional 5% for intermediate logs

queueProfile.description: Queue profile defines job queues appropriate for different types of workloads. Each queue has minimum guaranteed capacity and maximum allowed capacity. "SHARED" (Preemption On) option provides three queues with preemption - api(min:50, max:100), interactive(min:40, max:100) and default (min:10, max:100). "EXCLUSIVE" (Preemption Off) option provides two queues without preemption - dedicated(min:80, max:80) and default(min:20, max:20). Queue configuration can be customized on Cluster Manager.

shape.description: The compute shape to use for Big Data Cloud Servers. It defines how much memory, storage, and processing power should be allocated for each Virtual Machine of bdcsce. Compute Shape can be: oc2m: 2 OCPU, 30GB RAM. oc3m: 4 OCPU, 60GB RAM. oc4m: 8 OCPU, 120GB RAM. oc5m: 10 OCPU, 150GB RAM. VM.Standard1.4: 4 OCPU, 28GB RAM. VM.Standard1.8: 8 OCPU, 56GB RAM. VM.Standard1.16: 16 OCPU, 112GB RAM. VM.Standard2.2: 2 OCPU, 30GB RAM. VM.Standard2.4: 4 OCPU, 60GB RAM. VM.Standard2.8: 8 OCPU, 120GB RAM. VM.Standard2.16: 16 OCPU, 240GB RAM. VM.Standard2.24: 24 OCPU, 320GB RAM. BM.Standard1.36: 36 OCPU, 252GB.

sparkVersion.description: Spark Version.  Version of Spark to be installed.

serviceDescription.description: You may add an optional description that can be used to help identify this new service. The description is only used during service list display and is not used internally by Service Manager

serviceName.description: Name of Big Data Cloud instance. The service name: Must not exceed 50 characters. Must start with a letter. Must contain only letters, numbers, or hyphens. Must not contain any other special characters. Must be unique within the identity domain.

vmPublicKeyText.description: You can choose to enter a public key name, the public key text or have the service generate the key to use for service host access. SSH Access is disabled by default. To enable it, edit the Access Rules.

202.description: Accepted. Submitted job to create your service instance. See Status Codes for information about other HTTP status codes.

details.message: Submitted job to create service [bdcsce] in domain [identity].

jobId.description: Job Id of process started to create a service instance

message.example: Submitted job to create service [instanceName] in domain [identityDomainId].

412.description: Precondition Failed. Rejected request to create service instance.

issues: [Value for parameter [hdfsStor (5)] is not in valid limit 5-512000]

issues.description: Issues to be resolved for a succesfull request.

items.example: [Value for parameter [hdfsStor (5)] is not in valid limit 5-512000]

issues.title: issues-array

get.description: Returns information about all access rules defined for an Big Data Cloud instance.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME

202.description: Accepted. See Status Codes for information about other HTTP status codes.

accessRules.description: DO NOT MODIFY: Permit specific IPs to access Big Data Cloud port
Permit public access to Ambari REST
DO NOT MODIFY: Permit PSM to ssh access to admin host

destination.description: Specify the service component to which traffic should be allowed. For example, bdcsce_MASTER for the virtual machine where the bdcsce is running.

ports.description: Ports for the rule. This can be a single port or a port range. For example, 8989 or 7000-8000.

ruleType.description: Type of the rule which would be either SYSTEM, DEFAULT or USER. SYSTEM: This type of rule cannot be disabled or deleted. DEFAULT: This type of rule can be disabled or enabled. But cannot be deleted. USER: This type of rule can be disabled, enabled or deleted.

source.description: The hosts from which traffic is allowed. Valid values include: PUBLIC-INTERNET for any host on the Internet, A single IP address or a comma-separated list of subnets (in CIDR format) or IPv4 addresses, PAAS-INFRA for PSM. A service component name, Valid values include bdcsce_ADMIN_HOST, bdcsce_COMPUTE_SLAVE and bdcsce_MASTER.

status.description: Status of the rule whether enabled or disabled.

activities.description: Groups details about ongoing and failed activity messages, if available.

errors.description: Error encountered for an ongoing or failed activity.

message.description: Message of an ongoing or failed activity.

activities.title: activities-array

source.description: Network address of source. Specify the hosts from which traffic is allowed. post.description: Please find features available and their descriptions. Stop VM(s): Stop one or more VMs that are part of a service. At least one admin VM must be running unless complete service is stopped. Start VM(s): Start one or more VMs that have been stopped. Restart VM(s): Restart one or more VMs including the admin VM. This calls stop first and then start. Stop Service: Stop entire service, including the admin VM.  This feature is enabled by specifying allServiceHosts=true. Please note that there is no guarantee of the sequence in which VMs would stop. Start Service: Starting an entire service after it has been stopped. This feature is enabled by specifying allServiceHosts=true. Please note that there is no guarantee of the sequence in which VMs would start. Restart Service: Restarting ALL VMs in the service.

parameters.description: Identity domain Id for Big Data Cloud.
parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME

parameters.name: instanceName

parameters.description: JSON Object containing metadata to start/stop/restart service instance.

allServiceHosts.description: If it is true, then complete service instance will start/stop/restart.

components.description: Not required if allServiceHosts is true. This JSON contains a list of hosts to control. Note that the service instance is controlled if ALL hosts are listed, making this the same behaviour as including allServiceHosts as true

bdcsce.description: Specify this attribute if you want to start/stop/restart bdcsce VMs.

hosts.description: Specify Host Names of bdcsce VMs

put.description: Performs a precheck to identity potential issues that might prevent the specified patch from completing successfully without actually patching the service instance. Specifically, the patching precheck reports on the following conditions. Disk space shortage, Database connectivity failure, Server access failure, Storage access failure. Prechecks do not check whether another administration task (such as backup, restoration, or scaling) is in progress, which would prevent patching.

parameters.description: Base64 encoding of the user name and password of the user making the request.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.name: identityDomainId

parameters.name: instanceName

parameters.name: patchId

parameters.description: The request body is an empty JSON Object.
parameters.name: body

details.title: details

status.description: Status of the Patching Precheck operation. When first initiated, the status is set to New. The status may transition to one of the following values: Completed and Can not Complete

schema.title: Response Body

415.description: Unsupported Media Type. Rejected request to Performing a Patching Precheck. Might have caused because content-type is not specified as application/json in request headers.

get.description:
Returns all tags and tag assignments in the specified identity domain ID.

Use the optional ?services query parameter to list tags for one or more specific service instances.

Use the optional ?tagFilter query parameter to provide a search criteria based on tags.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Base64 encoded user name and password separated by a colon or OAuth access token obtained from Oracle Identity Cloud Service. See Authenticate.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: services
parameters.description:
When set to a specific service type and service name in the format service_type.instance_name, the response includes tags and assignments for the specified instance only. Use a comma separated list to get information for two or more service instances.

For example:

  • BDC.ExampleInstance
  • BDC.MyBDCInstance

parameters.name: tagFilter
parameters.description:
An expression using tag keys and values for filtering search results. Only results that satisfy the expression are returned in a search.

When creating your filter expression:

  • Use the percent sign (%) to match multiple characters.
  • Use the underscore character (_) to match a single character.
  • Precede a literal character by a backslash character (\) if a key or value contains a literal percent sign (%), apostrophe or single quote ('), or underscore (_).

Valid expressions include:

  • 'foo':'bar' - Finds all tags and assignments that have a key of 'foo' and a value of 'bar'
  • 'ora\_%':'%prod%' - Finds all tags and assignments that have a key starting with 'ora_' and a value containing 'prod'.
  • 'haMode' - Finds all tags and assignments that have a tag key of 'haMode'
  • 'ora\_%' - Finds all tags and assignments that a tag key starting with 'ora_'
  • 'site':'pe_r' - Uses the underscore wildcard to wildcard-match only a single character. For example, site=pear or site=peer is a match. site=pepper is not a match.
  • 'foo':'' - Finds all tags and assignments that have a tag key of 'foo' and an empty string as the value.
  • 'accuracy':'100\%' - Uses the literal percent sign in a value, so that it is not interpreted as a wildcard match.
  • 'type':'Abe\'s test' - Uses the apostrophe (single quote) in a key or value.
  • 'key\_contains\_underscores':'value\_does\_too' - Uses underscores in a key or value, so that they are not interpreted as single-character wildcards.

400.description:
Bad request.

If you get the message SM-UI-PROXY when you use the percent sign (%) to match multiple characters, this means the percent sign must be percent-encoded as %25. Try the command again using percent-encoding for the percent character.

post.description: Creates tags and assigns them to existing resources in the same request. You can also create tags without creating assignments.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Base64 encoded user name and password separated by a colon or OAuth access token obtained from Oracle Identity Cloud Service. See Authenticate.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the tags to create and the services to assign the tags to.

put.description:
Deletes one or more tags.

Set the optional ?force query parameter to true to allow tags to be deleted even if they are assigned to resources.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Base64 encoded user name and password separated by a colon or OAuth access token obtained from Oracle Identity Cloud Service. See Authenticate.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description:
Flag that specifies whether to allow (true) or not allow (false) tags to be deleted if the tags are assigned to resources. Default is false (do not delete if the specified tags are assigned to resources). Set to true to allow tags to be deleted even if there are tag assignments.

Also, the request will fail (false) or not fail (true) if any of the specified tags are not found.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the tags to delete.

204.description:
No content.

Successfully deleted one or more tags. There is no response body.

400.description:
Bad request.

An attempt was made to delete a tag that cannot be removed (for example, a system-provided tag cannot be deleted).

404.description:
Not found.

No tags with the specified key/value pair were found, and the force query parameter was not set to true.

delete.description:
Deletes all tags that have the specified key.

Set the optional ?removeAssignments query parameter to true to remove all tags and any existing assignments that match the specified tag key.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Base64 encoded user name and password separated by a colon or OAuth access token obtained from Oracle Identity Cloud Service. See Authenticate.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: tagKey
parameters.description: Tag key.

parameters.name: removeAssignments
parameters.description: Flag that specifies whether to allow (true) or not allow (false) deletion if there are tag assignments that match the specified key.

204.description:
No Content.

Successfully deleted one or more tags. There is no response body.

400.description:
Bad request.

An attempt was made to delete a tag that cannot be removed (for example, a system-provided tag cannot be deleted).

404.description:
Not found.

No tags with the specified key were found.

409.description:
Conflict.

One or more tags are assigned to one or more resources, and the removeAssignments query parameter was not set to true.

delete.description:
Deletes the tag that has the specified key and value. The value may be an empty string to match a tag that has an empty value.

Set the optional ?removeAssignments query parameter to true to remove the tag and any existing assignments that match the specified key and value.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud  account.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Base64 encoded user name and password separated by a colon or OAuth access token obtained from Oracle Identity Cloud Service. See Authenticate.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: tagKey
parameters.description: Tag key.

parameters.name: tagValue
parameters.description: Tag value.

parameters.name: removeAssignments
parameters.description: Flag that specifies whether to allow (true) or not allow (false) deletion if there are tag assignments that match the specified key/value pair.

204.description:
No Content.

Successfully deleted the tag. There is no response body.

400.description:
Bad request.

An attempt was made to delete a tag that cannot be removed (for example, a system-provided tag cannot be deleted).

404.description:
Not found.

No tag with the specified key/value was found.

409.description:
Conflict.

The tag is assigned to one or more resources, and the removeAssignments query parameter was not set to true.

put.description:
Creates and deletes tag assignments in the same request.

Set the ?createTagsIfNeeded query parameter to true to create new tags if the tag assignments in the payload contain tags that do not yet exist.

Set the optional ?force query parameter to true to force the request to complete even if any specified tags, service resources, or tag assignments are not found.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Base64 encoded user name and password separated by a colon or OAuth access token obtained from Oracle Identity Cloud Service. See Authenticate.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Big Data Cloud account.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Flag that specifies whether to allow (true) or not allow (false) the request to complete.

parameters.name: createTagsIfNeeded
parameters.description: Flag that specifies whether to allow (true) or not allow (false) tags to be created.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description:
The request body defines the tag assignments to create and delete.

Alternatively, you can omit TagsToUnassign and deleteAssignmentsFrom to just create tag assignments. Or you can omit TagsToAssign and createAssignmentsTo to just delete tag assignments.
